greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of k-element sets of nonempty multisets of positive integers with total sum n.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (rows n = 0..50)
example: Row n = 5 counts the following sets of multisets:
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add(binomial(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n$2)):
program: A(n)={my(v=Vec(prod(k=1, n, (1 + x^k*y + O(x*x^n))^numbpart(k)))); vector(#v, n, Vecrev(v[n],n))}
xref: Multisets of multisets are A061260, with row sums A001970.
Sets of sets are A330462, with row sums A050342.
Multisets of sets are A285229, with row sums A089259.
Sets of disjoint sets are A330460, with row sums A294617.
